"An adaptable long-haul industrial freighter that pilots have adapted to many different purposes."
# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the SMES unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the substation unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check the APC unit's current Load* (W).
## 1.2. P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit
- Check that P.A.C.M.A.N. generator units are anchored to the floor. - Check that P.A.C.M.A.N. generator units are fueled. For extended flights make sure that you have enough fuel stockpiled to sustain prolonged power generation. - Check that P.A.C.M.A.N. generator units are set to HV output. - Set Target Power to 13** [bold]kW[/bold] on each generator unit. - Start P.A.C.M.A.N. generator units.
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Check that the O2 canister is anchored to connector port. - Check that the N2 canister is anchored to connector port. - Check that the gas mixer is set to the correct mixing ratio (21% Oxygen, 79% Nitrogen). - Check that the gas mixer is set to 101kPa. - Enable gas mixer.
## 2.2. Waste Loop
- Enable waste loop pump. - Disable Auto Mode on the Air Alarm in the Engine Room. - Set the Air Alarm in the Engine Room to Filtering (Wide).
## 3. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the bow blast doors are closed.
## Sidenotes
* - Vagabond-class cargo ships are equipped with five APC units that can be used to appraise the ship's total power consumption. Unmodified Vagabond-class ship requires 24.6 kW of power to remain operational.
** - Vagabond-class cargo ships have higher power demand than single standard P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit can provide at optimal settings, however the ship comes equipped with two P.A.C.M.A.N. generator units, recommended target power output for each P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is 13 kW.
